name: Sleep Inn SeaTac Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With a long drive to Seatac and an early flight, I really needed a motel to stay in the night before - and watch the NCAA tournament. The high Trip Advisor rating on a low-cost motel seemed perfect - for $75 including tax I selected Sleep Inn. This is a crisp, clean and new-feeling place with wide, cheery lobby and corridor and clean, spacious rooms. We had a bed that seemed large enough for a party. It's a couple of miles from the airport but the shuttle service runs 24 hours and is direct. There is a breakfast buffet including the usual do-it-yourself waffles, and sausage too. There is also an IHOP just a few steps away. All the staff that I encountered, at the desk, the housekeepers, were excellent. Just what I needed. This is what Trip Advisor is for!
reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!

reviews.text: Friendly staff, clean rooms, nice continental breakfast, and airport shuttle - what more could you ask for?? The parking lot was jam packed, and so finding a parking space was not easy, but other than that, this is a good hotel airport!
reviews.title: Airport Hotel? Right here...

reviews.text: Have started staying here every time I have to fly out of SEA instead of Vancouver. Hotel seems newer construction or renovated. Very well maintained and clean. So are the rooms which are simple but practically furnished. Management will get out of their way to solve your problem if you have one (my shower had no water when I was in a rush to get to the airport: they promptly offered me another room to take a shower, organized a special shuttle to drive me to the airport and gave me a 50% discount on the next visit). The breakfast is not healthy or delicious, but better than 95% of the motels with similar prices. Their shuttle is timely and convenient (you can call them as you retrieve your luggage if you use them on your return flight or if you have left your car with them - stay and park package seem to be only bookable by phone).
reviews.title: Pre-plane and parking hotel: great at what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night and parked our car there for a week. Check-in was seamless and the staff were very good and friendly. They provide shuttle service and the nice thing is that it's just their hotels so you don't go on a milk run to a bunch of other hotels. Rooms were nice and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Good location for the airport

reviews.text: Loved this hotel - great value for park and fly at Seatac plus very secure underground indoor garage parking was a plus for us. Room was large, had a kitchenette. We enjoyed the cookies and a great breakfast which was available at 4am. We got to the hotel at about 3pm on a Sunday afternoon and were told that there were only 3 spaces left for park and fly. We wondered what we could do for the afternoon and evening. Turns out there are quite a lot of options that didn't have to involve moving our car. There's a hotel shuttle that will take you anywhere you want to go in a 2 or 3 mile radius incl to a nearby train station that goes in to Seattle. And, yay, there was also a shuttle from the nearby Southcenter Mall. Which is a wonderfully renovated huge mall that was very fun to shop at. We took the mall shuttle over there - it was free but the very funny and pleasant driver did take tips. Breakfast was a little mediocre but they had free internet and a couple of computers in the lobby which I appreciated. Spacious room, nicely appointed.
reviews.title: Take the free shuttle to Southcenter Mall

reviews.text: I got a great rate at this hotel for the night before my early morning flight, and it was very good for the price. The shuttle picked me up shortly after I called, and the front desk arranged for my shuttle trip the next morning at check-in. Room was not luxurious, but very comfortable and adequate for my one-night stay. Breakfast starts very early, which is important for early morning travelers, and it was nice to get my coffee fix and have a bowl of cereal before leaving for the airport (make-your-own waffles were available, too, but I preferred to get a little more sleep and have less breakfast time!). Only problem I had was that I had originally booked the hotel weeks before, then saw a better rate, so I cancelled my original reservation online and rebooked. When I arrived the hotel still had the original reservation plus my new one on file, but it was a simple matter for them to do the cancellation for the more expensive rate.
reviews.title: Convenient to airport, good basic rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, professional staff, and fantastic price. Great deal with the stay and Park. We have used before and always surprised on what a great place it is. Nothing fancy, just very functional. When you check in the front desk will put you on the Shuttle you need for the airport and call 10 minutes before if you are not downstairs. Very customer oriented.
reviews.title: Great deal at half the price

reviews.text: I used this as an overnight as I was leaving on an early flight. The check in was very efficient and they took the room number and time for the shuttle. The breakfast was very good but the best thing was that it started at 4am. That was such a treat as I had to leave at for the airport 5. The room was nice. Having the IHop next door was nice as well since I didn't have to leave the area. I would definately make this my hotel of choice near the Seattle airport.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: I arrived at the airport much later than expected due to delays and was impressed with the prompt shuttle and the smiling faces that greeted me at the front desk. A wonderful end to a stressful day traveling. The hotel was clean, my room was comfortable, and I was extremely impressed. I'll for sure stay here again next time I'm in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel twice during 2012. Both times I was very satisfied with my stay.
reviews.title: Great value
Great hotel for the price
reviews.text: We stayed here on a stopover on our way to Canada. We booked the hotel based on previous reviews and were not disappointed. The shuttle drivers were friendly and helpful. After just getting off a plane from Australia we were tired and the shuttle picked us up within 15 minutes. Check in was quick and easy and we were in our room within 10 minutes of arriving at the hotel. The free breakfast was a bonus, although it was quite crowded when we went down there was still plenty of food and it was topped up regularly. We were not taking a connecting flight but were going down town to get the Amtrak, so the shuttle driver dropped us off at the Light Rail and explained everything we needed to know clearly. We organised the shuttle time on check in and we were the only people on the shuttle-quick, easy and he was ready and waiting for us when we checked out. We would definitely stay here again. The distance from the airport did not matter to us as the plane noise was minimal and we heard very little traffic from the road. The room was spotless, the bed was comfortable and having the inoperable across the car park meant we did not have to go anywhere else.

I have stayed at this Sleep Inn several times over the past year. Nothing fancy but large rooms, coffe, microwave & refridgeator in the room if so desired. Always clean, attentive staff and free shuttle to/from airport. Competitive pricing, a very good value.
reviews.title: Close to the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second time around at the Sleep Inn and it remains a primo facility for park and fly at SeaTac. As before- keep in mind this is a 2 star house- and for that level of motel the score of Five is deserved. When we arrived we discovered the parking lot was filled with British Columbia plates- spring break in the great white north. The management had a valet out front to take care of the arriving cars. While our car was outside when we left, it was securely in the underground parking garage when we returned. The service, whether front desk, breakfast, housekeeping, valet or shuttle bus is top drawer. The rooms are large and comfortable, with many amenities including complementary internet. The beds, linens, towels and toiletries are better than most at this level of motel. The have a very early breakfast service for those travelers that have to be up and around at stupid early hours- not many others do. The shuttle service is excellent and runs every half hour. While It is a short distance south of the airport, it is easy to catch all freeways in any direction. For a very early departure or a very late arrival where you do not want to drive home, this is your place
reviews.title: Perfect Park and Fly at SeaTac

reviews.text: A great place to stay near the Seattle airport especially if value is important. The hotel is somewhat dated but excellent upkeep keeps it competitive. Breakfast has good variety but did not change the three days we were at the hotel. The staff is pleasant and attentive. The complimentary transportation is a great plus. The hotel could improve our stays if they removed the annoying ads experienced each time you sign on to the internet. Regardless we'd stay here again if in the Seattle airport area.
reviews.title: Excellent Value and Staff

reviews.text: We live 2 hours from Seatac, so whenever we go on a trip it's easier for us to come down the night before the trip, stay the night and catch the shuttle to the airport in the morning. We have tried a few hotels in the area and have always come back to the Sleep Inn. They have the best rates, the rooms are clean and fairly big and they offer the stay and fly option where you pay for one nights stay at the hotel and can park your car there for up to 2 weeks. We love it. It's quick, easy, they have a nice continental breakfast area setup so you can get a bit to eat before you leave and the shuttle service it really nice. Both for pick up and drop off. I would recommend the Sleep Inn if you're on a budget, but won't compromise on cleanliness & good service. Their staff is always friendly and I always get a great deal when we stay there. Looking forward to our next trip!
reviews.title: Great Stay and Fly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here a few times, now. Have always been satisfied. Very clean and comfortable, which is so nice after a long and tiring flight. Extensive breakfast available early. Reliable shuttle. IHOP right next door. Please dont change a thing!
reviews.title: Consistently good!

reviews.text: With their complementary shuttle service to the Seatac Airport and to the lightrail, along with their park and fly packages, this motel cannot be beat for the best place to stay while in or leaving Seattle. The lightrail takes you right into downtown. It's a 40 minute ride. A phone call when you get done,gets the shuttle to take you right back to the Sleep Inn. All meals are available at the I Hop restaurant, which is a one minute walk away. And the generous breakfast from 4 a.m. onward is complementary. So, I tip the people here to keep this great service going.
reviews.title: Comfort, value, & service.

reviews.text: My room was exceptionally clean and spacious with a queen bed and desk. The shower stall was quite large and sparkled. The shuttle service was prompt and friendly, which made going to the light rail a breeze.
reviews.title: Clean but noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The down side was I was on the highway side of the hotel (constant traffic!), near the ice machine (constant clinking!), and my neighbors woke at 2:30 for their flight (constant conversation!). Not a restful night's sleep for me.
reviews.title: I may have read the description wrong

reviews.text: I would return but request a room in the rear of the hotel away from the ice machine.. and take my chances with early rising neighbors!
reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!

reviews.text: This hotel surpassed my expectations! I was on the top floor and it was a very clean quiet room. The breakfasts in the morning were always stocked and fresh. The dining area was a little small and crowded, so I opted to eat in my room rather than wait for a table to open up. I was there several nights and they cleaned every day. The hotel staff was very friendly and weclcomed me every time I came in the front door. The parking lot is shared with an IHOP so they had to give me a parking voucher to park in the IHOP parking lot, as their own parking lot wasn't big enough. It was that way the whole time. It was easy to get in and out of, right off the main drag so getting to Tacoma, Seattle or the airport was all very easy.(I hate city driving, but this was fairly painless)
reviews.title: great for the price

reviews.text: The bathroom was awesome! A full stand-up shower (no tub in my room) and a toilet in a small room, with the sink and mirror in the main room area, so the shower didn't steam up the mirror. The price was great for the ammenities and location. I'll stay there again if I get back to the area. There were plenty of electrical outlets for charging devices. The t.v. was a bit small, the wifi was iffy, and my room had the mini pillows that many hotels seem to be moving to, but other than that, no major complaints.
reviews.title: Just right for affordable one-night stay pre-flight

reviews.text: I do not give five stars to a location because it worked out fine for me. I give five stars if the place is excellent and exceeds all expectations. I think it really throws people off to see five stars and then get somewhere and it is 3 star quality. That being said, this was a very decent, affordable place to stay the night before an early flight. It is clean, mostly updated but small. The continental breakfast is adequate. My husband, and I stayed with our two daughters ages 5 and 4 in a two bed room. The bathroom was very small and only a shower. The beds were okay. The service was very accommodating. There is an IHOP in the same parking lot. I would stay there again for a pre-flight stay.
reviews.title: Perfect for affordable one-night stay at Seatac

reviews.text: My flight arrived late from NYC and I was not able to go directly to Bellingham that night so I decided to stay at Seatac for one night. Sleep In offered exactly what I was looking for: a low price room for a 6-hour night near the airport. My experience was excellent through every interaction with Sleep In: the lady at the reception was incredibly professional and friendly, the shuttle picked me up super quickly, price was only ~$65 for Dec 23 night, the room was super clean and large and there was even a surprisingly good and convenient breakfast starting at 4am!
reviews.title: Affordable and comfortable

reviews.text: Even the driver on the way back to the airport was very friendly. Wow, unbeatable for $65
reviews.title: Just stayed for the fifth time...

reviews.text: Great place to stay for sleep and fly, very helpful and friendly staff. Rooms and all area of hotel very clean, breakfast was usual hotel breakfast. Free Internet access. Great shutte driver and easy parking.
reviews.title: Great sleep and fly

reviews.text: This is a great budget option airport hotel.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Great value for the rate.
reviews.title: exceptional service and generosity
Great overnight stop
reviews.text: Pro:
Airport shuttle pick up from light rail station and drop offs to airport. Very convenient, dont forget to tip!
reviews.title: Good for Park and Stay

reviews.text: If you have an early morning out of Sea-Tac this is the best hotel/motel I have found at a decent price. It is clean and everyone working there both helpful and friendly. There is an IHOP across the parking lot which is convenient, but don't ask me about dinner there . Best to eat breakfast for dinner.
reviews.title: Clean and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed twice at the Sleep Inn SeaTac, a bookending to a trip out of SeaTac. Even though the Hotel is getting a little dated, our rooms were large and adequate. The front desk staff is very helpful, as is the shuttle driver. When away on our trip, we had secure and covered parking at a reasonable rate.
reviews.title: Good service, good location

reviews.text: An affordable place to stay if you are at Sea Tac airport. People also have the option of sleep, park and fly.)
reviews.title: Wonderfull service by front desk and shuttle driver

reviews.text: Both outside and underground parking available, free while you stay, reasonable park and fly with stay,
reviews.title: Comfortable, good for a layover, but far from everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel breakfast is available at 4 am with airport shuttles to airport starting at around 4:30 (10 minutes to airport by shuttle.
reviews.title: Just what you need for overnight at airport

reviews.text: I selected this Motel based on Trip Advisor reviews, while planning my trip to a Seattle Seahawks game. I was concerned about proximity to the stadium, hoped for a decent night's sleep, and the added bonus of a continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Good place to stay for flights or the game

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff assured me that the lightrail would be close and that my stay should be comfortable. They were correct. In addition to a decent night's stay, the staff arranged for a shuttle ride to the light rail, making transportation a breeze. The desk clerk even gave us a voucher for a discount toward dinner at the neighboring casino. The room offered fast WiFi. The continental breakfast was hearty. Although the fixtures may be slightly older, the Motel is clean, quiet and comfortable. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good for budget control

reviews.text: Fairly quick shuttle pick-up, friendly. No hot water at sink; sink in same room as bed. Pocket/slide door to toilet/shower room. Thin wash cloths, scratchy TP. Good break fast - loved the granola. Best is low rate - $69 senior.
reviews.title: Yes, you DO want to stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently had the pleasure of staying at the Sleep Inn SeaTac twice in the month of December, first for five nights before traveling to visit family elsewhere in the State, then again for another four nights over New Year's before flying back to Brazil. Both stays were excellent - the hotel is clean, comfortable and a great value for the price, but it was the customer service that set's it apart.
reviews.title: Good place to stay before an early flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our flight was delayed in NYC, causing us to miss our connection to Seattle. I knew we'd have to pay for our reserved night, but wanted to make sure they knew we'd be there the next day on a different flight. Not only did they hurry to reassure me that they'd have a room ready when we got there, but they didn't charge me for the missed reservation, something I never expected. It shows that management empowers their staff to make decisions to make the guest experience a good one. That's an important difference in this property. These people seemed to LIKE where they worked!
reviews.title: Just close & far enough away from SeaTac

description: Located within 1.5 mile of SeaTac Airport, and 14 miles of downtown Seattle and Pike Place Market, 24 hours free shuttle service to the airport and anywhere within a 3 mile radius of the hotel. Sleep Inn SeaTac serves complimentary continental breakfast from 4am, free wireless internet access, business center with computer and printing service.
